intro: Palicourea divisorana, commonly known as the white-flowered palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Palicourea divisorana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
